data.sampled:
The answer is:
Saudi Arabia 

The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is the fifth-largest country by landmass in Asia and the 13th largest in the world. It has an area of approximately 2,150,000 square kilometers (830,000 sq mi).[9] Apart from its coastline on the Gulf of Oman in the southeast, most of the kingdom's border is with other countries; to the north it borders Kuwait and Iraq, to the east Jordan, Syria and Lebanon, Israel through the occupied territories of the West Bank and Gaza Strip, and Egypt to the southeast.[74][165] The interior of Saudi Arabia consists of five regions: the Najd Plateau, the Eastern Province centred on the Persian Gulf, the Red Sea Coast, the Arabian Desert in the south, and the mountainous Asir region near Yemen.
